name: Animal Disease Tracking Ireland Ltd
goal:
VirtualVet developed a smart phone app, web portal and support service to enable the consistent and thorough collection of animal health & drug usage data on-farm and in near real-time.
Our service is free to farmers but generates value to them when we sell their aggregated animal health & drug usage information as a surveillance service or as business intelligence to actors along the agri-food and animal health value chains.
Through extensive market engagement and from our position as a company built on a family farm, we work for the benefit of farmers to free up their time to focus on the important work – animal welfare – while we look after the paperwork, in near real-time, making them audit ready at the drop of a hat.
But as a data aggregation service we will work with partners to map, benchmark and visualise important trends, achievements or risks, such as reductions in antibiotic use in a region or early detection of disease, contributing to the responsiveness of policy makers, researchers and public health authorities.
The importance of this vision was clear in the discussions at our OECD supported workshop, AHEAD 2017, on March 1st & 2nd. With partners and contributors, we mapped out possible steps the animal health industry can take on the digital transformation journey to reduce the stress of compliance for farmers, while contributing to wider societal challenges, such as antimicrobial resistance and animal disease surveillance.
VirtualVet – we reduce risks.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Environment, Food Safety, Information Society, Public Health
euInitiatives: EU Animal Health Law, EU Digital Agenda, CAP reform
